additionalInfo: This is worth £450 per year for the average worker on £35,000.
text: Cut national insurance by 2p
Abolish the main rate of National Insurance for the self-employed
Introduce a pension Triple Lock Plus
additionalInfo:
The means the personal allowance for pensioners will always rise with inflation, earnings or 2.5%, whichever is higher.
This is already the case for the State Pension.

text: 30 hours a week free childcare when a 9 months of age until they start school

additionalInfo:
This would mean that child benefit is calculated based on a total household income, rather than thresholds for individual earners.
It will benefit families that have a single main earner.
text: Move to a household system for child benefit
No new green levies or charges to be introduced

additionalInfo: The National Service would allow a choice between a competitive placement in the military or civic service roles.
text: Introduce a mandatory National Service for all school leavers at 18
Fund 100,000 high-quality apprenticeships by curbing the number of poor-quality university degrees
Ban the use of mobile phones during the school day
Ensure parents can see what their children are being taught, especially on sensitive matters like sex education
Introducing the Advanced British Standard which combines A-Levels and T-Levels for 16-19 year olds
Increase defence spending to the 2.5% of GDP by 2030
Introduce a legal cap on migration to guarantee that numbers will fall every year
Deport illegal immigrants to Rwanda
Work with other countries to rewrite international asylum treaties
Increase NHS spending above inflation every year
Rewrite the Equality Act to define sex as biological sex
Abolish Stamp Duty for homes up to £425,000 for first time buyers
Recruit 8,000 more full-time, fully warranted police officers
Invest £36 billion in local roads, rail and buses, funded by cancelling the second phase of HS2
Reverse the London Mayor’s ULEZ expansion
Require local referendums for new 20mph zones and Low Traffic Neighbourhoods
Introduce a legal target and additional investment for food security
Protect agricultural land from solar farms
Cut Foreign Aid by 50%

additionalInfo: This would save £1,500 per year for workers that earn more than £20,000 and mean that 7 million people no longer pay any income tax.
text: Increase the personal tax allowance to £20,000
Scrap VAT on energy bills
Abolish inheritance tax for all estates worth less than £2M
Restart the VAT refund scheme for international tourists
Abolish Stamp Duty for homes up to £750,000
All water bosses to take a dip in British Rivers, to see how they like it
National Service to be introduced for all former prime ministers
WiFi on trains that works
Trains that work

additionalInfo: Ceefax was the world’s first teletext information service and a forerunner to the current BBC Red Button service.
text: Reintroduce Ceefax
Children in Need to finally get round to fixing Pudsey’s eye
Traffic on Northallerton High Street to be fixed by a new space bridge, bypassing both level crossings
European countries to be invited to join the UK, creating a new ‘Union of Europe’
Wallace and Gromit to be knighted, for services to Wensleydale
Build at least one affordable house
Croissants to be price-capped at £1.10 and 99 flakes to cost 99p
National Yorkshire Pudding Day to be a bank holiday (except for banks)
Ban loud snacks from cinemas and theatres
Pensions to be double-locked, but with a little extra chain on the side
Claudia Winkleman’s fringe to be Grade 1-listed
A new series of Gladiators to feature '90s Gladiators against age-appropriate contenders
Minsters' pay to be tied to that of nurses for the next 100 years
Shops that play Christmas music before December to be closed down and turned into public libraries
To combat the UK’s increasingly wet climate, all British citizens to be offered stilts
Ban on speakerphones on public transport. Offenders to be forced to live with Matt Hancock for a year
The mini golf course at Richmond swimming pool to host the open championship
MPs to live in the area they wish to serve for 4 years before election, to improve local representation
The hand dryer in the gents’ urinals at The Crown & Treaty, Uxbridge to be moved to a more sensible position.
Count Binface to represent the uk at eurovision
